name: gh
description: Work seamlessly with GitHub from the command line.

auth.description: Authenticate gh and git with GitHub

login.description: Log in to a GitHub account

logout.description: Log out of a GitHub account

status.description: Display active account and authentication state on each known GitHub host

token.description: Print the authentication token gh uses for a hostname and account

browse.description: Transition from the terminal to the web browser to view and interact with:

options.name: branch
options.description: Select another branch by passing in the branch name

options.name: commit
options.description: string[="last"]   Select another commit by passing in the commit SHA, default is the last commit

options.name: no-browser
options.description: destination URL instead of opening the browser

options.name: projects
options.description: repository projects

options.name: releases
options.description: repository releases

options.name: repo
options.description: [HOST/]OWNER/REPO   Select another repository using the [HOST/]OWNER/REPO format

options.name: settings
options.description: repository settings

options.name: wiki
options.description: repository wiki

code.description: Open a codespace in Visual Studio Code

cp.description: Copy files between local and remote file systems

rename.description: Rename a file in a gist

options.name: repo
options.description: [HOST/]OWNER/REPO   Select another repository using the [HOST/]OWNER/REPO format

comment.description: Add a comment to an issue

develop.description: Manage linked branches for an issue

list.description: List organizations for the authenticated user.

options.name: repo
options.description: [HOST/]OWNER/REPO   Select another repository using the [HOST/]OWNER/REPO format

list.description: List pull requests in a repository

status.description: Show status of relevant pull requests

checkout.description: Check out a pull request in git

checks.description: Show CI status for a single pull request

comment.description: Add a comment to a pull request

diff.description: View changes in a pull request

ready.description: Mark a pull request as ready for review

review.description: Add a review to a pull request

field-create.description: Create a field in a project

field-delete.description: Delete a field in a project

field-list.description: List the fields in a project

item-add.description: Add a pull request or an issue to a project

item-archive.description: Archive an item in a project

item-create.description: Create a draft issue item in a project

item-delete.description: Delete an item from a project by ID

item-edit.description: Edit an item in a project

item-list.description: List the items in a project

link.description: Link a project to a repository or a team

list.description: List the projects for an owner

mark-template.description: Mark a project as a template

unlink.description: Unlink a project from a repository or a team

options.name: repo
options.description: [HOST/]OWNER/REPO   Select another repository using the [HOST/]OWNER/REPO format

delete-asset.description: Delete an asset from a release

list.description: List repositories owned by user or organization

deploy-key.description: Manage deploy keys in a repository

fork.description: Create a fork of a repository

gitignore.description: List and view available repository gitignore templates

set-default.description: Configure default repository for this directory

options.name: repo
options.description: [HOST/]OWNER/REPO   Select another repository using the [HOST/]OWNER/REPO format

run.description: List, view, and watch recent workflow runs from GitHub Actions.

options.name: repo
options.description: [HOST/]OWNER/REPO   Select another repository using the [HOST/]OWNER/REPO format

download.description: Download artifacts generated by a workflow run

view.description: View a summary of a workflow run

watch.description: Watch a run until it completes, showing its progress

workflow.description: List, view, and run workflows in GitHub Actions.

options.name: repo
options.description: [HOST/]OWNER/REPO   Select another repository using the [HOST/]OWNER/REPO format

run.description: Run a workflow by creating a workflow_dispatch event

view.description: View the summary of a workflow

alias.description: Aliases can be used to make shortcuts for gh commands or to compose multiple commands.

import.description: Import aliases from a YAML file

set.description: Create a shortcut for a gh command

api.description: Makes an authenticated HTTP request to the GitHub API and prints the response.

options.name: cache
options.description: Cache the response, e.g. "3600s", "60m", "1h"

options.name: field
options.description: key=value       Add a typed parameter in key=value format

options.name: header
options.description: key:value      Add a HTTP request header in key:value format

options.name: hostname
options.description: The GitHub hostname for the request (default "github.com")

options.name: include
options.description: HTTP response status line and headers in the output

options.name: input
options.description: The file to use as body for the HTTP request (use "-" to read from standard input)

options.name: jq
options.description: Query to select values from the response using jq syntax

options.name: method
options.description: The HTTP method for the request (default "GET")

options.name: paginate
options.description: additional HTTP requests to fetch all pages of results

options.name: preview
options.description: Opt into GitHub API previews (names should omit '-preview')

options.name: raw-field
options.description: key=value   Add a string parameter in key=value format

options.name: silent
options.description: not print the response body

options.name: slurp
options.description: with "--paginate" to return an array of all pages of either JSON arrays or objects

options.name: template
options.description: Format JSON output using a Go template; see "gh help formatting"

options.name: verbose
options.description: full HTTP request and response in the output

download.description: Download an artifact's attestations for offline use

trusted-root.description: Output trusted_root.jsonl contents, likely for offline verification

verify.description: Verify an artifact's integrity using attestations

completion.description: Generate shell completion scripts for GitHub CLI commands.

options.name: shell
options.description: Shell type: {bash|zsh|fish|powershell}

config.description: Display or change configuration settings for gh.

get.description: Print the value of a given configuration key

list.description: Print a list of configuration keys and values

set.description: Update configuration with a value for the given key

extension.description: GitHub CLI extensions are repositories that provide additional gh commands.

browse.description: Enter a UI for browsing, adding, and removing extensions

install.description: Install a gh extension from a repository

search.description: Search extensions to the GitHub CLI

gpg-key.description: Manage GPG keys registered with your GitHub account.

add.description: Add a GPG key to your GitHub account

delete.description: Delete a GPG key from your GitHub account

list.description: Lists GPG keys in your GitHub account

options.name: repo
options.description: [HOST/]OWNER/REPO   Select another repository using the [HOST/]OWNER/REPO format

clone.description: Clones labels from one repository to another

delete.description: Delete a label from a repository

preview.description: Preview commands are for testing, demonstrative, and development purposes only.

prompter.description: Execute a test program to preview the prompter

ruleset.description: Repository rulesets are a way to define a set of rules that apply to a repository.

options.name: repo
options.description: [HOST/]OWNER/REPO   Select another repository using the [HOST/]OWNER/REPO format

check.description: View rules that would apply to a given branch

list.description: List rulesets for a repository or organization

secret.description: Secrets can be set at the repository, or organization level for use in

options.name: repo
options.description: [HOST/]OWNER/REPO   Select another repository using the [HOST/]OWNER/REPO format

ssh-key.description: Manage SSH keys registered with your GitHub account.

add.description: Add an SSH key to your GitHub account

delete.description: Delete an SSH key from your GitHub account

list.description: Lists SSH keys in your GitHub account

status.description: The status command prints information about your work on GitHub across all the repositories you're subscribed to, including:

options.name: exclude
options.description: Comma separated list of repos to exclude in owner/name format

options.name: org
options.description: Report status within an organization

variable.description: Variables can be set at the repository, environment or organization level for use in

options.name: repo
options.description: [HOST/]OWNER/REPO   Select another repository using the [HOST/]OWNER/REPO format
